title: The History of Solar Energy
description: One-minute skill: The History of Solar Energy.

hook.text: In 1954, Bell Labs built the first practical solar cell. It powered a small toy Ferris wheel.

buildup.text: Early cells converted just 6% of sunlight. They cost $1,000 per watt â€” absurdly expensive.

discovery.text: NASA became the first big customer, putting solar panels on satellites in the 1960s.

twist.text: The oil crisis of 1973 sparked interest in solar for homes â€” then oil prices dropped and so did funding.

climax.text: Solar costs fell 99% since 1976. It is now the cheapest electricity source in history.

punchline.text: From a toy Ferris wheel to the cheapest power on Earth.
